name: israel
text: A comment left by israel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by antecen, Zoltan, morbo)

name: deimosrising
text: If this had ultimately led to more Ultra Peanut that would have been awesome, but I'm pretty happy with what we got.

name: nessotron
text: I loved this character, his greasy locks, and hick voice, in comparison to Phillipe's squeakingly perfect enunciation brings tears to my eyes. Seriously.

name: aarongstock
text:
It's Tigger!
(Years after the checks stopped arriving from Disney and A. A. Milne's estate)

name: blarghamagarky
text: holy shit

name: unklmnky69
text: wow, it really is.....

name: terriblerobot
text: Now I can't unsee it. Goddamn.

name: terriblerobot
text: So...if that's Tigger (and I want to believe with all my heart that is what Onstad subtly intended), what happened to the rest of them?

name: ttagxamm
text: Greasy locks, but such a kindly face.

name: tragicone
text: The kindly face may belie a devilish man. Never judge a book by its cover.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...but what if the building's on fire? Don't be a hero, man - just do it and get out.

name: theguitarhero
text: My brother died that way.

name: fermatprime
text: My brother actually died that way. Not funny, not cool, not a good comment.

name: kaithekender
text:
It was actually a pretty good comment in my opinion

You can't expect the world to put the safety on because you're sensitive about a certain subject.

name: tragicone
text: try what I did. Only 10k up front.

name: patkun
text:
Isn't he Scottish? He says 'Y'ken' which means 'you know' in highland dialect...
Which brings me back to the question, how the hell does onstad know that? How wide IS this man's field of knowledge?

name: geesycreesy
text: probably from the novel Trainspotting. A lot of well written dialects show up in that one.

name: straw
text: Well, this strip is Trashspotting.  That's some cold subtle reference that is

name: slalvation
text: I don't know, I think that's actually pretty common knowledge?

name: phthoggos
text: or perhaps he read such as X-Men comics as a child

name: thesoulbear
text: or The Dark Tower

name: drskradley
text: I took him as having a Northern US/Lower Canadian "Fargo" sorta accent.  However, there was a high influx of Scots Gaelic into NorthEastern Canada, around Nova Scotia and some islands there.  But this isn't Saskatchewan by any stretch.  I am unaware of the accent of the Nova Scotians, let alone with Gaelic infusions.

name: soticoto
text:
That guy is Scottish; not Nova Scotian.

Nova Scotians only have the faintest hints of scottish left in their accent. They're all "Oat 'n aboat 'n a boat" sorta thing. A real Scot would pronounce the word "boat" more like "buht" (like "book" but with a "t"): totally different sound.

And how do I know this?
My father was Scottish and I was married to a Nova Scotian.
Emphasis on was in both cases.

name: yearsinhotclaws
text: Please stop growing your beard into my eyes.

name: lizjones
text: Does Phillipe ever tell the trash hobo his name? The world may never know.

name: teknofatcat
text: He is indeed Scottish. Lookit that moustache.

name: nessotron
text: My mind is blown, Scottish indeed.

name: riazm
text: I wish that final frame was blown up massive. For desktop or even poster purposes.

name: circadin
text: Funny, I assumed that panel is the reason this strip is rated relatively low.

name: riazm
text:
Riazm! It's yourself from the future, I blew up that last panel fairly massive. it's here:

name: i_love_kate
text: Ooh, I ust remembered about eBay Platinum Reserve. The anticipation!

name: spinynorman
text: Fucker is straight out of Faulkner, guys.

name: stuart
text: I'm going to twist your words into a comparison of Phillipe with a Faulknerian Idiot Man-Child and disagree.

name: spinynorman
text: Um, I meant the dude with the moustache?

name: yomimono
text:
"Faulknerian Idiot Man-Child" is one of my favorite phrases. Thanks for reminding me about it.

(It has wicked meter in addition to good content)

name: spinynorman
text: http://www.theonion.com/content/node/37422

name: yomimono
text: That is the first place I saw the phrase. Way to inhabit a part of the cultural landscape similar to mine. high fives

name: fosters
text: Good thing there's always one helpful hobo. I hope Phillipe kept his promise and told the old Scot his name.

name: professorhazard
text: And, perhaps, gave him a dollar his mommy gabe him.

name: unsentletter
text: We are all waitin' fer the tug, in our own ways.

name: runningonempty
text: obviously philippe is now more pissed than ever, the people of ultra peanut are taking his couches!
